Reviews.Title: “Relatively close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Oslo13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night, arriving late in the evening. Average place with helpful staff and OK breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tourists beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn1962
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a week in this hotel and I couldn't wait to get on here and leave a review. Due to a mix-up at the airport, I needed to find a holiday, and quickly, as I was using an internet cafe. I found the Aldobrandeschi on Thomas Cook's website, and booked a week for myself and my husband, beginning the following day. We shared a taxi shuttle from Fuimicino with another couple. The driver told us it was a long way away, not wrong there, it cost us 60 euros! First impressions of the hotel, shabby from the outside but the reception area looked fine. We were given the key to our room on the 3rd floor and went straight up, after being told that the restaurant was only for breakfast and that meals could be arranged at a local restaurant, with a free shuttle. We went to our room and it smelt of rotten cabbage and the bed was solid, so we went back down to reception and asked for another. The room was on the 5th floor, no smell and the bed was a little softer. Anyway, to cut this saga short: Good points: Clean rooms Fresh towels daily Bad points: No free internet, internet was on computer in the lobby, 3 euros for half an hour Decor very dated No restaurant Breakfast average but coffee foul 1 small Peroni and 1 Disaronno and lemonade in the bar = 12.50 euros Miles from anywhere, 4 bus changes into the centre of Rome(or Metro which I hate) Minibar wasn't stocked until we asked, then on checkout (after paying city tax) was charged 6 euros for 2 bottles of water Invasions from coachloads of Chinese tourists every day - very loud and rude Asked for 2 drinks to be brought to our room and was told there would be a 5 euro charge for this - 1 Peroni, 5 euros, I cappuccino, 2 euros, room service, 5 euros = 12 euros, no thanks! This hotel was definitely not my idea of a 4 star hotel, and I think the rating needs urgently reviewing. Not a hotel to spend a week in, more like a stopover on the way to somewhere else. However, if you do stay here, make sure you ask the staff to book you a table at the local restaurant, fantastic service and wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the city, old furniture, bad smell, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Rossonerro
Reviews.Content: First I have to admit that the price paid per night was 50 euros, so if you consider that accomodation in Rome in that period of the year is more expensive, I have to admit that it was a fair price. We stayed in Aldobrandeschi hotel for 3 nights, and tried to visit the most important parts of Rome. Positive things: - price Negative aspects: - Rude staff (when we told them that we are from Romania, they visibly changed the way they treated us). As an advice for Romanian tourists, in Rome, generally speaking, avoid telling anybody your origin or else you will be treated very bad... - Dirty everything: bathroom, towels, bedclothes, curtains etc. - Old furniture - Bad smell - Far away from the city. There is a bus that can take you in the city, but you have to wait 30-40 minutes. The bus goes until 22.30 and if you want to stay longer in the city... Near the hotel you don't have anything, only some bureau buildings and some dirty hills. So, I won't recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Gcacace
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice and clean, the rooms (our) wasn't excellent, showed signs of wear and tear but overall quite confortable, no wi-fi connection (not working), excellent breakfast and staff very friendly and helpful. Shame it's too far away from the centre of Rome, the bus 892 is punctual and passes just in front on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel but really really far from everything.”
Reviews.Author: VacaPrincess82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average for the price. It was very far from everything which quite honestly put a damper on our Rome vacation. I really wish they were a bit more clean. There was an odor in the room and in October there was no airconditioner so we would have to sleep with the window open and could hear things outside. The bed was hard and the covers were a bit dirty. The bathroom was fine but still not the best. This hotel is a bit rundown. The breakfast was ok nothing to write home about. All in all if you are concerned about money this would be a good hotel if you dont mind the 40 minute commute to the nearest tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Servise, nice breakfast, but small bed/room.”
Reviews.Author: hilroy2010
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome after a long trip in Barcelona. The hotel we stayed in Bracelona was absolutely first class, it was 5 stared. On the way to Rome, we found out that the hotel we are going to stay in is 4 stared. So it won't be very bad. But when we came inside the hotel, my eyes dropped (no offence). The lobby is tiny compare to the hotel we stayed in Barcelona! I was dissapointed then, but when i came to the front desk, the people working there replied me with a very friendly voice and very good british english (rare in Italy!). I found that fairly interesting. The price is affordable and the breakfast is nice... Wish u have a good stay there!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: merlina78
Reviews.Content: Very far from city center, but near to Melià where most Events take place. Small rooms, no restaurant service even for smal fruit salad or coffee. Hair in bed. Old TV with only 4 channels. Forget about Wi-fi, no connection in the whole hotel. If you are visiting Rome as a tourist, stay away and reserve in the centre. If you are visiting for business at the Melia Convention Center it's ok, but just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Anti-American staff couldn't be less accomodating to our group”
Reviews.Author: mcpopkes
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of students for three weeks throughout Europe, and this was by far the worst hotel in which we stayed. First of all, the students were constantly being followed and harassed by the staff. There was nowhere for them to gather in the hotel, other than in their rooms, even though the downstairs had several rooms which could have been utilized. Our students were very well behaved, but were constantly being looked at suspiciously. They bought sandwiches which were prepared by the staff, and then were questioned as to whether or not they had paid for them! The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, and the students attempted to exit the buiding. They were blocked from doing so at the bottom of the stairs and yelled at by the night staff, told to go back to bed as the alarm contined to sound. I approached the gentleman and attempted to explain that we evacuate buildings when we hear fire alarms, and then he yelled at me saying the "Americans cause nothing but confusion." and that he didn't have any problems with Japanese, Chinese... etc only Americans." He was extremely explosive and rude. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with children, or Americans, as its staff are clearly not welcoming to either.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Kolban
Reviews.Content: We spend a night in this hotel... The rooms were old and the hotel in general appeared shabby but it was clean. The breakfast was ok, but not more than that. They brand themselves with four stars. This is not a four star hotel.... more like a to and a half star. The location was in a rural area and I still wonder why they placed a hotel on this spot. Service in the hotel was ok. The price - 42 euro through Skoosh - was excellent, so I didn't expect much. Good hotel for a one night stay going to/coming from Fiumincino airport

Reviews.Title: “Hotel so far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Ituassu
Reviews.Content: Apartments always clean, employees are very rude and thick with customers, breakfast low quality, located an hour from the city center and away from the main sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel, definately be back.”
Reviews.Author: cam_161
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to rome and will be back again. our hotel was lovely. the bus stops right outside the hotel and we took this into metro station cornelia, (approx 20 minutes) from there we were able to do all the sightseeing we wanted too. the hotel room was spotless and the room was cleaned every day. it would have been nice having tea/cofee facilities in the room but as the restraunt was opened from 7am this was not really a problem. hotel staff were all friendly and helpful and we were sorry we couldnt stay for longer. one our first night staff even recommended a local restraunt, and it was excellent, they even picked us up at the hotel and dropped us off afterwards. great value for a 4 star hotel. carol from glasgow

Reviews.Title: “Far Far Far Far Away from centre!!”
Reviews.Author: Dimmitrisd_Greece
Reviews.Content: Far away from centre and underground station! It has a bus however nearby it takes about 15 - 20 minutes to get to centre! Be aware when it is "feriale" days! You then have to take the 2 buses+underground to get to centre. The breakfast was very poor! The staff however was helpful and willing.

Reviews.Title: “far, far away...”
Reviews.Author: LorLev
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel and don't mind spending half an hour or more to get into Rome, this may be the hotel you're looking for. Otherwise, don't bother. Take a bus and then the metro to get into town - or just spend 17€ each way on a taxi. If you have no choice, then at least ask for a room with a bath tub. Our room had a stall shower that was so small, the curtain kept sticking to my body. Breakfast that is included consists of hard boiled eggs, cheese, rolls and cheap jams. Concierge was not able to find us a decent restaurant in Rome and there are none in the neighborhood. No wireless internet, no English-language TV, few electrical outlets in the room (one by the door and one in the bathroom). ...as for the four stars? Hair dryer and phone in bathroom, check. Mini bar, check. Safe in the room, check. That's about it. Nothing more. Basic, boring- clean, cheap and far, far away...

Reviews.Title: “a very warm and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianne8868
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aldobrandeschi for 3 nights and agree with others who say the staff are friendly, helpful and informative. They staff also speak good English which was one thing that surprised me about the rest of Rome that very little English is spoken. I tried booking on the hotel website as the rate was slightly better, however had some difficulties with this so ended up booking via expedia. The rooms were fine breakfast was continental so very basic. There is no restaurant in the actual hotel but there is plenty of choice in and around the city. The hotel also has an arrangement with a restaurant nearby and can arrange free transportation if you want to eat nearer the hotel. The food is reasonable. The hotel is some distance away from the City and main attractions. If using public transport you can get a travel ticket for 11 euros for 3 days which i felt was good value for money. The Metro is very easy to use. The hotel is about 45 mins away from Vatican which is the nearest attraction. You have to get a bus outside the hotel No:892 to the nearest metro station Cornelia metro line A and then from the metro its another 15mins or so into the centre. A taxi to the city would cost about 30 euros. From the nearest airport a taxi costs about 50 Euros. If you do single journeys on the metro then the cost is 1 euro per 75mins. All in all I enjoyed my 3 day stay and but perhaps would stay a little nearer to the city if im ever in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: debbie77Tolone
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Rome and stayed for two nights in hotel Aldobrandeschi, we found this hotel to be ok. The rooms and beds were clean, the air con/heating in the room was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Sadly the hotel is quite a distance from a great many of the tourist spots, the Vatican is the nearest and is about a 15 minute taxi; from there you can get a sightseeing bus which will take you close or to other places of interest. Watch out for the taxi drivers at the airport, make sure they have got the meter running, we did find a really good one for our return journey, his English was superb and he charged us 26 euro's less than the first one. All in all for what we payed for the trip it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: crjenny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a clean and modern hotel - nothing special, but comfortable and functional for the price we paid (€ 100.00 for a double room). We had room 310 which had a nice large bed and large bathroom. Friendly & helpful staff. We also had great service in the bar, where we went for a drink after dinner. The hotel is very well located to the airport, about 15 minutes with a taxi, but you need to take a bus or a taxi for the city center. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: Anca_18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, the rooms are excelent , the breakfast it is ok for an italian hotel .There is a bus in front of the hotel and the receptionist will help you with the schedule for the bus ( in average at 20 minutes ) . It takes 30-40 minutes ( depends on traffic) to reach the nearest metro station . We paid 57 Euro ( the reservation was made on ---.com with 4 months in advance) for a matrimonial room and the pictures show the reality from the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rescampo
Reviews.Content: we paid € 90,00/night for a double room. The hotel is very clean and the receptionist are very helpful with tourist. The location is about km. 10 from St.Peter's church and you can reach the city center with a bus and the metrò, or with a taxi (about € 10 and 15 minutes). You will have a simple self service breakfast in continental style and the coofee is very good. I consider this location a good " value for money" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i urge you to visit rome because despite all the irritations of the aldobrandeschie this magnificient city is worth it and despite the best efforts of the staff this functional and clean hotel is not ready for visitors they have no facilities for money changing it is too far from city centre, ten bus stops and five metro, when we where there in jan 2005 the buses stopped at 1900 for road words which also gave major headheaches for the taxi drivers (most of them had no idea where the hotel was) who charged from E15 - E20, a barrier across the drive was never lifted and this meant a walk across a dark and lonely car park to a very uninviting entrance, it also meant that all traffic sat tooting horns at all hours breakfast was a totally sweet affair with no chance of anything cooked and the bar served only packets of nuts no shoe cleaning machines dirty laundry was loaded onto a filthy truck through the front entrance no local info, brochures etc no fire drill or safety info anywhere displayed hotel faces noisy rear of melia roma hotel lots of newspapers and mags but all in italian, tele but only in italian room service unable to grasp the concept of T for 2 (got a bit annoying after the third time) one day this hotel might be worth the hassle but not yet, spend the money on accomodation closer to the city and save the taxi fares

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport? No way!”
Reviews.Author: WendyManchester
Reviews.Content: We wanted an hotel near Leonardo da vinci airport in rome as we were arriving late at night and were picking a car up at the airport the following morning. The review given was that this hotel was convenient for this airport. IT WASN'T. A return trip to the airport cost 75 euros which was quite a chunk out of our holiday budget. The hotel itself was o.k., but was not in a leafy suburb as described. This spoilt the start to our holiday.

HotelInfo.Name: Aldobrandeschi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via degli Aldobrandeschi 295, 00163 Rome, Italy
